system.description: The true wanderer, they are a bit like Amazons of the land. Always on the move and scouting about, rangers never like to have much responsibility if they can help it and prefer to be on their own. Gritty and worn like old leather, these characters are unflinching and realistic at all times. If you are playing a Ranger, keep watch, seek solitude, long for the woods and be introspective.

overview.base: You take the triggering @L[Core:Damage]{damage} as a @L[Damage:Hack]{limb hack} instead. All @L[Category:Damage types]{damage types} still apply. If the hit was critical, you instead take it as two @L[Damage:Hack]{limb hacks}. If the @L[Core:Damage]{damage} was dealt by a creature, they choose which limb is affected. If not, it is random.

system.trigger: You are hit by an @L[Category:Attack abilities]{attack} that would @L[Core:Damage]{damage} you.

results.critHit: The target automatically fails the first [[/roll 2d4]] roll.

system.endCondition: At the end of each of the target's @L[Core:Turn]{turns}, they roll [[/roll 2d4]]. If either of these dice roll a 4, this effect ends.

overview.base: You are an @L[Keyword:Expertise]{expert} @L[Tradecraft:Tracker]{tracker}. In addition, you gain @L[Ability:Agile]{Agile} outside towns and other urban areas.
You have @L[Core:Advantage]{advantage} on checks made with @L[Ability:Perceive]{Perceive}.
You walk through difficult terrain at @L[Core:Movement Speed]{normal speed}.
